data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

parameters.text:
=You are a LinkedIn post writer. You will be given a title and your task is to create an engaging LinkedIn post based on that title.

Your post should:

Begin with a compelling hook related to the title

Include 3-4 paragraphs of informative content

End with a question to encourage engagement

Include 4-6 relevant hashtags

Use appropriate emojis in between

Important formatting requirements:

Format all paragraphs with proper newline characters (\n\n) between them

Ensure the text is properly escaped for JSON

Do not use double quote (") in response or any special character

Do not put asterisk

Keep the overall length appropriate for LinkedIn (under 3000 characters)

Now, create a LinkedIn post based on the following title:
{{ $('Linkedin-Post-Topic').item.json['Linkedin Post Title'] }}

parameters.content:
LinkedIn AI Agent: Auto-Post Creator & Distributor
Automatically generate engaging LinkedIn posts from Google Sheets topics and publish them to your profile and multiple LinkedIn groups. Perfect for:
‚úÖ Content creators ‚Äî scale your LinkedIn presence effortlessly
‚úÖ Marketers ‚Äî maintain consistent professional posting
‚úÖ Thought leaders ‚Äî amplify reach across relevant communities

‚öôÔ∏è What's Used
n8n Nodes:
Google Sheets Trigger ‚Üí AI Agent ‚Üí OpenAI Chat Model ‚Üí LinkedIn API ‚Üí Group Distribution
External Tools:

Google Sheets ‚Äì Store post topics and group IDs
OpenAI GPT-4 ‚Äì Generate engaging LinkedIn content
LinkedIn API ‚Äì Publish to profile and groups
Custom Formatting ‚Äì Ensure proper LinkedIn formatting


üîë Setup ‚Äì Credentials Needed

Google Sheets OAuth2 ‚Üí Access your content spreadsheet
OpenAI API Key ‚Üí For AI content generation
LinkedIn OAuth2 ‚Üí Publish posts to your profile and groups
HTTP Request Auth ‚Üí LinkedIn API authentication headers


üìä Google Sheets Structure Required
Create a spreadsheet with two sheets:
Sheet 1 - Main Posts:

ID (unique identifier)
LinkedIn Post Title (topic/title for AI to expand)
Status (Pending/Posted)

Sheet 2 - Groups:

GroupIds (LinkedIn group IDs you want to post to)

Note: You'll need to collect LinkedIn group IDs from groups you've joined and have posting permissions for.

üöÄ Workflow Steps

Monitor Google Sheets
Trigger watches for new "Pending" status posts every minute
Generate AI Content
AI Agent creates engaging LinkedIn posts with:

Compelling hooks
3-4 informative paragraphs
Engagement questions
Relevant hashtags and emojis


Format for LinkedIn
Ensures proper JSON formatting and character limits
Publish to Profile
Posts directly to your personal LinkedIn profile
Distribute to Groups
Automatically shares to all specified LinkedIn groups
Update Status
Marks the post as "Posted" in Google Sheets


üìù Content Generation Features
AI-Powered Writing:

Professional tone and structure
Proper LinkedIn formatting with newlines
4-6 relevant hashtags
Strategic emoji placement
Under 3000 character limit
Engagement-focused questions

Smart Processing:

JSON-safe formatting
Special character handling
Paragraph structure optimization


üí° Pro Tips

Start with 3-5 LinkedIn groups to test posting permissions
Use descriptive post titles in your spreadsheet for better AI generation
Monitor group engagement rules to avoid spam flags
Schedule posts by updating status from "Pending" at desired times
Keep a backup of successful post formats for consistency
